question: Who among the following held that, "the flexibility and rigidity of a constitution depends not so much upon the breadth of the written provisions or upon the process of amendment, as it depends upon the character or temperament of the people"?
explanation: It was Lawrence, who held that, "the flexibility or rigidity of a constitution depends not so much upon the breadth of the written provisions or upon the process of amendment, as it depends upon the character or temperament of the people" and also held that a flexible constitution is better than a rigid constitution.
